text.section:
An authority may:
Set rates, fees, and charges for the services and facilities of its water system that are sufficient to pay:
The cost of maintenance, repair, and operation of its sewerage system; and
The principal of and interest on bonds that the authority issues for its sewerage system; and
Subject to prior pledges of surplus revenue, pledge any surplus revenue of its water system for the purposes stated in item (1) of this subsection.

section.section:
If any premises obtain all or part of their water from a source other than a public water system, an authority may charge the premises for sewerage services:
By gauging or metering; or
In any other manner that the authority approves.

text.section: An authority may base rates, fees, and charges for any of its other services and facilities on any factor that the authority determines to be reasonable and proper.

The rates, fees, and charges of an authority shall be:
Reasonable;
Uniform by class; and
Determined solely by the authority.

section.section:
Any person who questions whether the rates, fees, or charges of an authority are reasonable or uniform may sue the authority:
In the circuit court for the county in which the project is located; or
If the project is located in 2 or more counties, in the circuit court for the county in which the principal office of the project is located.
The circuit court has exclusive jurisdiction to determine the reasonableness and uniformity of the rates, fees, and other charges of an authority.
